events.originalText: Suicide bombers assassinated Pakistani politician Shuja Khanzada and killed at least 21 others at his home in Attock District.
events.subtitle: 2015 Attock bombing
events.headline: Suicide bombers assassinate Pakistani politician Shuja Khanzada in Attock District

events.originalText: At the World Championships in Athletics in Berlin, Usain Bolt ran the 100 metres in 9.58 seconds, breaking his own record set a year earlier.
events.subtitle: 2009 World Championships in Athletics
events.headline: Usain Bolt breaks 100m record at World Championships in Athletics

events.originalText: Typhoon Wayne formed over the South China Sea, going on to become one of the longest-lived tropical cyclones in the north-western Pacific, lasting 21 days.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Wayne (1986)
events.headline: Typhoon Wayne becomes long-lived tropical cyclone in South China Sea

events.originalText: American singer and actor Elvis Presley was found dead in his home in Memphis, Tennessee.
events.subtitle: Elvis Presley
events.headline: Elvis Presley found dead in Memphis home

events.originalText: The English rock band the Beatles fired their drummer Pete Best , replacing him with Ringo Starr (pictured).
events.subtitle: The Beatles
events.headline: The Beatles fire drummer Pete Best, replace with Ringo Starr

events.originalText: Widespread riots between Hindus and Muslims took place in Calcutta following the All-India Muslim League's call for an independent Pakistan.
events.subtitle: Direct Action Day
events.headline: Riots between Hindus and Muslims in Calcutta

events.originalText: The Stanley Internment Camp in Hong Kong was liberated following the announcement of the surrender of Japan in World War II.
events.subtitle: Stanley Internment Camp
events.headline: Stanley Internment Camp in Hong Kong liberated after Japan's surrender

events.originalText: The Holocaust: During the deportation of Jews from Slovakia, President Jozef Tiso gave a speech describing Jews as "parasites" and "the eternal enemy".
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: President Jozef Tiso describes Jews as 'parasites' during deportation from Slovakia

events.originalText: A long-running dispute between Muslims and Jews over access to the Western Wall in Jerusalem escalated into a week-long period of violent riots throughout Palestine.
events.subtitle: Western Wall
events.headline: Violent riots erupt over access to Western Wall in Jerusalem

events.originalText: Ray Chapman of the Cleveland Indians was hit by a pitch and died the following day, becoming the only Major League Baseball player to die directly as a result of injuries sustained during a game.
events.subtitle: Ray Chapman
events.headline: Cleveland Indians player Ray Chapman dies after being hit by pitch

events.originalText: The Battle of Radzymin, one of the bloodiest and most intense battles of the Polish–Soviet War, concluded with a Polish victory.
events.subtitle: Battle of Radzymin (1920)
events.headline: Polish victory in Battle of Radzymin

events.originalText: The British parliament's Blind Persons Act received royal assent, becoming the first first disability-specific legislation to be passed anywhere in the world.
events.subtitle: Blind Persons Act 1920
events.headline: British parliament passes first disability-specific legislation

events.originalText: An earthquake registering approximately 8.2 Mw struck Valparaíso, Chile, killing 3,882 people.
events.subtitle: 1906 Valparaíso earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Valparaíso, Chile kills 3,882 people

events.originalText: Second Boer War: A 10,000-strong column of soldiers led by Lord Kitchener broke a 13-day siege of a small garrison.
events.subtitle: Second Boer War
events.headline: Lord Kitchener breaks siege in Second Boer War

events.originalText: A group including George Carmack and Skookum Jim Mason (pictured) discovered gold  near Dawson City, Canada, setting off the Klondike Gold Rush.
events.subtitle: George Carmack
events.headline: Gold discovered near Dawson City, Canada, sparking Klondike Gold Rush

events.originalText: San Sebastian Church in Manila, the only all-steel church in Asia, was officially consecrated.
events.subtitle: San Sebastian Church (Manila)
events.headline: San Sebastian Church in Manila consecrated as only all-steel church in Asia

events.originalText: Following Spain's annexation of the Dominican Republic, nationalist rebels raised the Dominican flag in Santiago de los Caballeros to begin the War of Restoration.
events.subtitle: Spanish occupation of the Dominican Republic
events.headline: Dominican Republic rebels raise flag in War of Restoration

events.originalText: Around 15 people were killed and 400 to 700 others injured when cavalry charged into a crowd demanding the reform of parliamentary representation in Manchester, England.
events.subtitle: Cavalry
events.headline: Cavalry charges into crowd demanding parliamentary reform in Manchester, England

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: American forces routed British and German troops at the Battle of Bennington in Walloomsac, New York.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: American forces defeat British at Battle of Bennington

events.originalText: War of the League of Cambrai: English and Imperial forces defeated French cavalry, forcing them to retreat.
events.subtitle: War of the League of Cambrai
events.headline: English and Imperial forces defeat French cavalry in War of the League of Cambrai
